title: Top Executives From Shell, Exxon, Chevron, BP, to Face Adversarial House Panel
sub_head: Democrats contend the oil-and-gas industry covertly resists climate legislation; Republicans brand hearing as political theater
body:
WASHINGTON—Top executives from four of the largest Western oil companies— Exxon Mobil Corp., Chevron Corp. , BP PLC and Royal Dutch Shell PLC—are set to face lawmakers Thursday for questioning on the sincerity of their pledges to cut emissions and support other measures to address climate change.
Top Democrats on the House Oversight and Reform Committee have asked the chief executives of Exxon and Chevron and the heads of the U.S. units of BP and Shell to testify about what the lawmakers say is a yearslong campaign by the oil industry to spread disinformation about the role of fossil fuels in causing global warming.
